gr.forth.ics.util
Interface Accessor<E>

Type Parameters:
E - the type of the element being accessed
public interface Accessor<E>

An Accessor is a handle to an element contained in a FastLinkedList, direct access to it, its previous and next elements in the list, etc.

Accessor objects are created by FastLinkedList, and all operations of these objects take constant time.

See Also:
FastLinkedList, FastLinkedList.addFirst(Object), FastLinkedList.addLast(Object)

Method Summary
 Accessor<E> addAfter(E element)
          Adds a new element immediately after the element of this accessor, in the owner from its owner FastLinkedList, and returns a new Accessor to the newly inserted element.
 Accessor<E> addBefore(E element)
          Adds a new element immediately before the element of this accessor, in the owner from its owner FastLinkedList, and returns a new Accessor to the newly inserted element.
 E get()
          Returns the element represented by this accessor.
 boolean isRemoved()
          Returns whether the element of this accessor has already been removed from its owner FastLinkedList (not necessarily through the remove() method).
 ListIterator<E> listIterator()
          Returns a list iterator to traverse the owner FastLinkedList right from the position of the element of this accessor.
 void moveAfter(Accessor<E> accessor)
          Moves the element of this accessor immediately after the element of the given accessor.
 void moveBefore(Accessor<E> accessor)
          Moves the element of this accessor immediately before the element of the given accessor.
 void moveToBack()
          Moves the element of this accessor to the back (end) of the owner FastLinkedList.
 void moveToFront()
          Moves the element of this accessor to the front (start) of the owner FastLinkedList.
 Accessor<E> next()
          Returns an accessor that represents the element immediately after the element represented by this accessor, in the owner FastLinkedList.
 FastLinkedList<E> owner()
          Returns the FastLinkedList instance that contains this accessor, or null if this accessor has been removed.
 Accessor<E> previous()
          Returns an accessor that represents the element immediately before the element represented by this accessor, in the owner FastLinkedList.
 boolean remove()
          Removes the element of this accessor from its owner FastLinkedList.
 E set(E newElement)
          Replaces the element of this accessor with a new, and returns the old one.
 

Method Detail

remove

boolean remove()
Removes the element of this accessor from its owner FastLinkedList.

Returns:
true if the element was indeed removed, or false if it was not there

isRemoved

boolean isRemoved()
Returns whether the element of this accessor has already been removed from its owner FastLinkedList (not necessarily through the remove() method).

set

E set(E newElement)
Replaces the element of this accessor with a new, and returns the old one.

Parameters:
newElement - the element with which to replace the element represented by this accessor
Returns:
the old value of this accessor
Throws:
NoSuchElementException - if there element of this accessor has been removed

Returns the element represented by this accessor.

Throws:
NoSuchElementException - if there element of this accessor has been removed

addAfter

Accessor<E> addAfter(E element)
Adds a new element immediately after the element of this accessor, in the owner from its owner FastLinkedList, and returns a new Accessor to the newly inserted element.

Parameters:
element - the new element to insert to the owner list
Returns:
an accessor to operate on the newly inserted element
Throws:
NoSuchElementException - if there element of this accessor has been removed

Parameters:
element - the new element to insert to the owner list
Returns:
an accessor to operate on the newly inserted element

next

Accessor<E> next()
Returns an accessor that represents the element immediately after the element represented by this accessor, in the owner FastLinkedList.

Throws:
NoSuchElementException - if there element of this accessor has been removed

previous

Accessor<E> previous()
Returns an accessor that represents the element immediately before the element represented by this accessor, in the owner FastLinkedList.

Throws:
NoSuchElementException - if there element of this accessor has been removed

listIterator

ListIterator<E> listIterator()
Returns a list iterator to traverse the owner FastLinkedList right from the position of the element of this accessor. Specifically, the returned iterator will be positioned right after the element of this accessor, i.e. an immediate listIterator.previous() would yield this accessor's element, while listIterator.next() would yield its next. To put it in other words, the returned iterator would be at the same starting position as one created by myList.listIterator(indexOfElement + 1) The returned iterator

Throws:
NoSuchElementException - if there element of this accessor has been removed

moveToFront

void moveToFront()
Moves the element of this accessor to the front (start) of the owner FastLinkedList.

Throws:
NoSuchElementException - if there element of this accessor has been removed

moveToBack

void moveToBack()
Moves the element of this accessor to the back (end) of the owner FastLinkedList.

Throws:
NoSuchElementException - if there element of this accessor has been removed

moveAfter

void moveAfter(Accessor<E> accessor)
Moves the element of this accessor immediately after the element of the given accessor. If the specified accessor is this accessor itself, nothing happens.

Throws:
NoSuchElementException - if there element of this accessor has been removed
IllegalArgumentException - if the specified accessor is null, or if it does not have the same owner FastLinkedList as this accessor.

moveBefore

void moveBefore(Accessor<E> accessor)
Moves the element of this accessor immediately before the element of the given accessor. If the specified accessor is this accessor itself, nothing happens.

Throws:
NoSuchElementException - if there element of this accessor has been removed
IllegalArgumentException - if the specified accessor is null, or if it does not have the same owner FastLinkedList as this accessor.

owner

FastLinkedList<E> owner()
Returns the FastLinkedList instance that contains this accessor, or null if this accessor has been removed.

Returns:
the owner of this accessor, or null if this accessor has been removed
